definition: in custody/to keep sb in detention
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to mortgage/to pawn/to detain in custody/to escort and protect/(literary) to sign

sentences.english: Asked during imprisonment what crime he had committed and he will most often say he was accused of stealing.
sentences.chinese: 收押时，问他犯了什罪，他最常说自己被诬控偷盗。

sentences.english: The police detained the suspected thief for further questioning.
sentences.chinese: 警方收押了盗窃嫌疑犯以作进一步审问。

sentences.english: An executing organ shall take a criminal into custody without delay and notify the family members of the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 执行机关应当将罪犯及时收押，并且通知罪犯家属。

definition: to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
